org.orgName: District Court of the United States for the District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF BEN WA, FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS FOR TUNG KEE.

This cause having come on for hearing this day, upon the application of Ben Wa for a writ of habeas corpus for Tung Kee, the court having entered an order to show cause, directed to Ellis De Bruler, commissoner of immigation, to show cause why a writ of habeas corpus should not be granted herein, and the petitioner having asked for an order staying deportation, and the court being fully advised in the premises,

IT IS NOW ORDERED that the said Ellis De Bruler, as sommissioner of immigration of the United States, withhold the order of deportation granted by the secretary of Commerce and Labor herein, until the further order of this court.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this order be in full force, virtue and effect upon the petitioner giving proper security to the said commissioner of immigration for the necessary expense of keeping the said Tung Kee under the jurisdiction of this court, until the final determination hereof.
Done in open court this 9th day of July, 1912.
